# GitHub Topics Configuration

To maximize discoverability, add these topics to your GitHub repository.

## How to Add Topics

1. Go to https://github.com/wojukasz/VimCode
2. Click the ‚öôÔ∏è gear icon next to "About" (top right of the repository page)
3. In the "Topics" field, add the topics listed below
4. Click "Save changes"

## Recommended Topics

Copy and paste these topics (space-separated):

```
vim vscode neovim lazyvim vscodevim vscode-vim vim-config vim-configuration keybindings modal-editing productivity developer-tools vim-keybindings vscode-settings dotfiles text-editor code-editor lsp gitlens cursor-editor windsurf vim-mode vscode-keybindings editor-config keyboard-shortcuts
```

## Topic Categories

### Primary Keywords (Most Important)
- `vim` - Core technology
- `vscode` - Target platform
- `neovim` - Related ecosystem
- `lazyvim` - Inspiration/style
- `vscodevim` - Main extension

### Configuration Keywords
- `vim-config`
- `vim-configuration`
- `vscode-vim`
- `vscode-config`
- `vscode-configuration`
- `vscode-settings`
- `editor-config`
- `dotfiles`

### Feature Keywords
- `keybindings`
- `keyboard-shortcuts`
- `vim-keybindings`
- `vim-bindings`
- `vscode-keybindings`
- `modal-editing`
- `vim-mode`

### Use Case Keywords
- `productivity`
- `developer-tools`
- `text-editor`
- `code-editor`

### Integration Keywords
- `lsp`
- `gitlens`

### Supported Editors
- `cursor-editor`
- `windsurf`

## Why These Topics Matter

GitHub uses topics to:
- Help users discover repositories through topic pages
- Show related repositories
- Improve search ranking
- Enable topic-based filtering
- Generate recommendations

For example:
- Topic page: https://github.com/topics/vscode-vim
- Search: https://github.com/search?q=topic:vim+topic:vscode

## Monitoring Topic Performance

After adding topics, monitor:
1. Traffic sources in GitHub Insights
2. Referrals from topic pages
3. Compare before/after traffic

Topics usually take 24-48 hours to be fully indexed by GitHub's search.

## Additional Repository Settings

While you're in the About settings, also:
- [ ] Add a short description (400 chars max)
- [ ] Add your website URL (if applicable)
- [ ] Check "Releases" if you use GitHub Releases
- [ ] Check "Packages" if you use GitHub Packages

**Suggested description:**
```
üöÄ LazyVim-inspired Vim configuration for VS Code | 50+ keybindings | Full LSP & Git integration | Works with VS Code, Cursor & Windsurf
```
